Tetris.mods.Interfaces package¶

Submodules¶

Tetris.mods.Interfaces.BoardInterface module¶

class Tetris.mods.Interfaces.BoardInterface.InputType[source]¶

Bases: object

InputType defines possible ways to put input to BoardInterface.

Possible input types are:

  1. MACHINE
  2. HUMAN
  3. SAVE
MACHINE = 0¶
HUMAN = 1¶
SAVE = 2¶
type2code = {'human': 1, 'machine': 0, 'save': 2}¶
tostr = {0: 'Machine', 1: 'Human', 2: 'Save'}¶
class Tetris.mods.Interfaces.BoardInterface.BoardInterface(input_type='machine', machine=None, maxtick=-1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

BoardInterface defines basic functionalities as interface. No visual module is implemented. To use visual functionalities, use VisualInterface.

Parameters:
  • input_type (str) – type of input. ‘machine’, ‘human’, or ‘save’
  • machine (Tetris.mods.Machines.Machine.Machine) – machine to play when input_type is ‘machine’
board = None¶

Tetris.mods.Board.Board instance which to interact with.

width = None¶

Width of board.

height = None¶

Height of board.

machine = None¶

Tetris.mods.Machines.Machine instance which may play Tetris. None if no machine is provided.

isStarted = None¶

True if started. False if stopped.

isOver = None¶

True is over. False otherwise.

actionhistory = None¶

List of actions taken. (tick, action) pairs are stored.

piecehistory = None¶

List of spawned pieces. (tick, shape) pairs are stored.

trajectory = None¶

List of state. (S,A,R,S’) quadruples are stored.

G = None¶

Return so far. Starts from 0.

settings = None¶

Dictionary of settings include followings:

  1. save_hist
  2. save_traj
  3. refresh_traj
  4. collect_traj
  5. collect_hist
  6. verbose_gameover
  7. input_type
  8. filename
  9. name

#TODO explanation about all the settings.

initialize()[source]¶

initialize() initializes interface.

  1. clear actionhistory, piecehistory, trajectory.
  2. reset G.
  3. set board to start state(S0) by calling Tetris.mods.Board.Board.S0().
S()[source]¶

S() returns a current state of board in a tuple form.

Tuple contains:

  1. Copied matrix of table
  2. Copied list of pieces
  3. Copied matrix of piececoords
  4. curX
  5. curY
  6. t
  7. isOver
Returns state:current state in a tuple form
Return type:tuple
S0()[source]¶

S0() sets board to a start state.

#TODO explain more in detail.

setS(other)[source]¶

setS() sets board‘s state to given other. Set states by value, not by reference.

The format of other should be the same as that returned by S().

Parameters:other (tuple) – state to be set
load_savefile()[source]¶

load_savefile() loads actionhistory and piecehistory from settings['filename'].

This is supposed to be called only when settings['input_type'] is InputType.MACHINE.

save_history()[source]¶

save_history() saves actionhistory and piecehistory to file.

For example, the file name is Human_150_2016-12-20_13_22-05-123412.sav

save_trajectory()[source]¶

save_trajectory() saves trajectory to file.

tick(event)[source]¶

tick() call OnTick().

If the game is over, call gameover().

OnTick()[source]¶

OnTick() samples an action from machine and perform it by calling perform_action().

newshape()[source]¶

newshape() gives new shape.

If settings['collect_hist'] is On, save it to piecehistory.

Return newshape:
 integer in [1,7]
Return type:int
gameover()[source]¶

gameover() unsets isOver, and thus stops MDP.

If settings['save_hist'] is On, call save_history().

If settings['save_traj'] is On, call save_trajectory().

perform_action(action)[source]¶

perform_action() performs action by calling Tetris.mods.Board.Board.T().

Accumulate resulting reward to G.

If settings['collect_hist'] is On, save (tick, action) to actionhistory.

If settings['collect_traj'] is On, save (s, a, r, s’) pair to trajectory.

Parameters:action (int) – action to perform
Returns result:(reward, isvalid)
Return type:tuple
start()[source]¶

#TODO

Refresh()[source]¶

Refresh() does nothing.

class Tetris.mods.Interfaces.BoardInterface.DummyInterface(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Tetris.mods.Interfaces.BoardInterface.BoardInterface

DummyInterface is an BoardInterface that has no additional functionalities.

This class is usually as an interface of dummy board which is used for simulation in MC machines.

perform_action(action)[source]¶

perform_action() performs action by calling Tetris.mods.Board.Board.T().

Accumulate resulting reward to G. For performance, no additional option is provided in this method.

Parameters:action (int) – action to perform
Returns result:(reward, isvalid)
Return type:tuple
gameover()[source]¶

gameover() does nothing.

Tetris.mods.Interfaces.RLInterface module¶

class Tetris.mods.Interfaces.RLInterface.PGInterface(machine, pgmode, lr=0.0001, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Tetris.mods.Interfaces.BoardInterface.BoardInterface

PGInterface is an interface that can run policy gradient algorithms. It runs several policy gradient algorithms on its machine.

Parameters:
  • machine (Tetris.mods.Machine.Machine) – machine to play and be trained
  • pgmode (str) – type of Policy Gradient algorithms. ‘vanilla’, ‘pgt’, and ‘actorcritic’ are available.
  • lr (float) – learning rate
Gs = None¶

Hisotry of Return throughout training.

Hs = None¶

Hisotry of horizon length throughout training.

learn = None¶

Learning function. Learns by calling train_core.

train_core = None¶

Core training theano function.

build_trainer_vanilla()[source]¶

build_trainer_vanilla() compiles a train_core theano function which implements Vanilla Policy Gradient algorithm, and algorithm-specific learn function.

build_trainer_pgt()[source]¶

build_trainer_pgt() compiles a train_core theano function which implements PGT Policy Gradient algorithm, and algorithm-specific learn function.

build_trainer_actorcritic()[source]¶

NOT IMPLEMENTED

train()[source]¶

train() is a top-level train function. Repeatedly calls start() to produce trajectories and learn.

Every 100 episode, it saves history and model weights.

start()[source]¶

start() runs one episode and produces one trajectory.

After each episode is done, it calls learn function to learn.

Returns (G, H):(Return, Horizon)
Return type:(float, int)
class Tetris.mods.Interfaces.RLInterface.ValueRLInterface(machine, rlmode, lr=0.0001, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Tetris.mods.Interfaces.BoardInterface.BoardInterface

ValueRLInterface is an interface that can run value-based learning algorithsm. It runs several learning algorithms on its machine.

Value-Based learning algorithms are all basically forcing Bellman Equation on visited states. Available training algorithms are:

  1. DQN
  2. Q-Learning
  3. SARSA
  4. Expected-SARSA
Parameters:
  • machine (Tetris.mods.Machine.Machine) – machine to play and be trained
  • rlmode (str) – type of learning algorithms. ‘q-learning’, ‘dqn’, ‘double-dqn’, ‘sarsa’, and ‘expected-sarsa’ are available.
  • lr (float) – learning rate
Gs = None¶

Hisotry of Return throughout training.

Hs = None¶

Hisotry of horizon length throughout training.

Costs = None¶

Hisotry of Value-Approximation costs throughout training.

learn = None¶

Learning function. Learns by calling train_core.

train_core = None¶

Core training theano function.

build_trainer_dqn()[source]¶

build_trainer_dqn() compiles a train_core theano function which implements DQN, and algorithm-specific learn function.

build_trainer_qlearning()[source]¶

build_trainer_qlearning() compiles a train_core theano function which implements Q-Learning, and algorithm-specific learn function.

build_trainer_sarsa()[source]¶

build_trainer_sarsa() compiles a train_core theano function which implements SARSA, and algorithm-specific learn function.

build_trainer_n_sarsa()[source]¶

build_trainer_n_sarsa() compiles a train_core theano function which implements n-step SARSA, and algorithm-specific learn function.

build_trainer_expectedsarsa()[source]¶

build_trainer_expectedsarsa() compiles a train_core theano function which implements Expected-SARSA, and algorithm-specific learn function.

build_trainer_doubledqn()[source]¶
build_trainer_doubleqlearning()[source]¶

build_trainer_doubleqlearning() compiles a train_core theano function which implements Double Q-Learning, and algorithm-specific learn function.

start()[source]¶

start() runs one episode and produces one trajectory.

After each episode is done, it calls learn function to learn.

Returns (G, H):(Return, Horizon, cost) cost is a cost estimate for value approximation.
Return type:(float, int, cost)
train()[source]¶

train() is a top-level train function. Repeatedly calls start() to produce trajectories and learn.

Every 100 episode, it saves history and model weights.
